name: Flux 2 Pro Image Generator and Editor Kie AI
description:
Generates, Edits or Combines image(s) according to text instructions and reference image(s) using the Flux 2 Pro model from Black Forest Labs, via the kie.ai API.
Supports up to 8 local reference images.
Pricing (as of November 2025): ~$0.025 per image at 1K resolution, and ~$0.035 per image at 2K.
Get your API key at https://kie.ai
author: @@official.shinkai

api_key.description: Required API key for kie.ai API authentication

default_aspect_ratio.description: Optional default aspect ratio for the generated images. One of '1:1', '4:3', '3:4', '16:9', '9:16', '3:2', '2:3', 'reference' (matches the aspect ratio of the 1st reference image). Defaults to '4:3'

max_duration.description: Optional maximum duration in seconds to wait for task completion. Default: 300 (equal 5 minutes)

polling_interval.description: Optional interval in seconds for polling the task status (how often to check if image generation is complete). Default: 5

input_image_paths.description: Optional list of full local paths to 1-8 reference input images for image-to-image. Accepted types: .jpeg, .png, .webp. Max 10MB per file. Omit for striclty text-to-image.

prompt.description: Required text prompt describing the desired image to generate (for text-to-image), and eventually how to edit or combine the reference image(s) (for image-to-image), max 5000 characters

filename.description: Optional base filename for the created image (without extension). Defaults to None (uses task_id)

aspect_ratio.description: Optional override to set the aspect ratio of the generated image. One of '1:1', '4:3', '3:4', '16:9', '9:16', '3:2', '2:3', 'reference' (atches the aspect ratio of the 1st reference image). Defaults according to config if empty

resolution.description: Optional resolution of the generated image. Must be '1K' or '2K'. Defaults to '1K'

saved_image_path.description: Local path where the image was saved

status.description: Status of the operation, e.g., 'success' or starts with 'error:' or 'partial_success:'

temporary_image_url.description: Temporary URL of the generated image from the API
